title: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 1
summary:
Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 1 (SARS-CoV-1 or SARS-CoV)[2] is a strain of coronavirus that causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), the respiratory illness responsible for the 2002â€“2004 SARS outbreak.[3] It is an enveloped, positive-sense, single-stranded RNA virus which infects the epithelial cells within the lungs.[4] The virus enters the host cell by binding to 
angiotensin-converting enzyme 2.[5] It infects humans, bats, and palm civets.[6][7]
